alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 19 at 5:31PM EDT until May 19 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Indiana, including the following counties, Daviess, Greene, Knox and Sullivan. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 531 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Linton, Worthington, Dugger, Lyons, Carlisle, Elnora, Oaktown, Sandborn, Switz City, Newberry, Pleasantville, Vicksburg, Freelandville and Paxton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
